title: Stacey Solomon ‘in talks’ with Simon Cowell for The X Factor: All Stars
text:
Stacey Solomon is in talks for X Factor: All Stars (Picture:Ken McKay/ITV/REX)

Stacey Solomon has revealed she’s set to chat with Simon Cowell about returning for The X Factor: All Stars.

This year the X Factor is replacing the traditional series with two special editions; a celebrity version and an all-stars series which brings back past contestants.

While the line-up for the celebrity version has been revealed, featuring Love Island supergroups and Megan McKenna, it’s still unknown which acts will be back for the all stars series.

One person we can probably rely on is Stacey Solomon, who has revealed she’s set to have talks with Simon Cowell about possibly returning to the show.

Simon Cowell is hoping to secure Stacey Solomon for the line up (Picture: Gregg DeGuire/Getty Images)

Asked by Closer magazine her opinions on Simon, Stacey said: ‘He’s really nice! He’s always been great to me.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘They are doing The X Factor: All Stars series later this year, where they bring back past contestants. He said he wants to talk about it with me, so I think I’ve got to have a phone call with him soon!’

Stacey finished third on the sixth series of X Factor back in 2009, and has since gone onto appear on shows I’m A Celebrity… Get Me Out Of Here and Loose Women.

But who could be potentially joining Stacey? Louis Walsh previously claimed Leona Lewis, Alexandra Burke, and Shayne Ward would all be returning, although the latter has since ruled himself out.

Ray Quinn has also been tipped to return despite his acting commitments to Hollyoaks.

The celebrity edition is set to kick off this Saturday, and judge Louis Walsh recently teased it’s more ‘slick’ than the traditional show.

‘I think what we’re doing this year is a brilliant idea and everyone is going to love watching these celebrities. The show feels more exciting,’ Louis said.

‘There’s no boot camp, no six chair challenge – it feels slick this year. It’s been the best show on TV for a long time and has just had a little rebranding.’

The X Factor: Celebrity kicks off Saturday 12 October on ITV at 8.35pm.

description: Stacey Solomon may have landed a spot on the line-up for The X Factor: All Stars.
